intro: Acrodon duplessiae, commonly known as the desert stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are small and fleshy, helping to reduce water loss. Acrodon duplessiae is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities, contributing to the biodiversity of these harsh environments.
